options.label: build
options.description: The commit alters the build system or external dependencies of the product (adding, removing, or upgrading dependencies).

options.label: change
options.description: The commit changes the implementation of an existing feature.

options.label: chore
options.description: Updating grunt tasks etc; no production code change

options.label: ci
options.description: Changes to our CI configuration files and scripts (example scopes: Travis, Circle, BrowserStack, SauceLabs)

options.label: deprecate
options.description: The commit deprecates existing functionality, but does not remove it from the product. For example, sometimes older public APIs may get deprecated because newer, more efficient APIs are available. Removing the APIs could break existing integrations so the APIs may be marked as deprecated in order to encourage the integration developers to migrate to the newer APIs while also giving them time before removing older functionality.

options.label: perf
options.description: A code change that improves performance

options.label: refactor
options.description: A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature

options.label: revert
options.description: The commit reverts one or more commits that were previously included in the product, but were accidentally merged or serious issues were discovered that required their removal from the main branch.

options.label: security
options.description: The commit improves the security of the product or resolves a security issue that has been reported.

options.label: style
options.description: Changes that do not affect the meaning of the code (white-space, formatting, missing semi-colons, etc)

options.label: test
options.description: Adding missing tests or correcting existing tests

commit-message-editor.tokens.label: Scope
commit-message-editor.tokens.name: scope
commit-message-editor.tokens.description: A scope may be provided to a commitâ€™s type, to provide additional contextual information and is contained within parenthesis, e.g., "feat(parser): add ability to parse arrays".

commit-message-editor.tokens.label: Short description
commit-message-editor.tokens.name: description
commit-message-editor.tokens.description: Short description in the subject line.
